image.altText: A woman in a white shirt is photographed outdoors with soft sunlight and greenery in the background.

props.synopsis: SA fashion entrepreneur Carol Foord turned to alternative treatments before her death. A year on her family is still seeking answers about how her final hours played out.

title.children: An Adelaide fashion icon died after using magic mushrooms. Her family wants answers

image.altText: Woman with blonde hair talking to media.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has secured enough support from the state's crossbench to pass its proposed new child protection laws, despite warnings from advocates that the reforms do not comply with United Nations conventions.

title.children: New child protection laws with a focus on safety, set to pass SA parliament

image.altText: A woman with long brunette hair smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Prema Osborne left the Metropolitan Fire Service last week just weeks after the SA Employment Tribunal found travel payments to firefighters were unlawfully withheld and were "a failure of management diligence".

title.children: SA fire service's top executive leaves after damning tribunal decision

image.altText: A farmer in a blue shirt and cap stands beside the back of his ute, flanked by a kelpie dog on each side

props.synopsis: As South Australian farmers continue to battle keeping businesses afloat during the ongoing drought, many are calling for interest rate relief for loans so they can feed animals and cover essentials.

title.children: Farmers battling drought call for low-interest loans 'not a handout'

image.altText: Grant Stevens in police uniform and hat outside a building with revolving glass door

props.synopsis: SA Police has launched a commissioner's inquiry after a man became unresponsive while being arrested last week in Adelaide's east.

title.children: Inquiry called after man becomes unresponsive during attempted arrest

image.altText: a man in a black puffer jacket stands among knee-high desiccated crops

props.synopsis: With this year's winter grain crop planted, ABARES estimates drought and dry conditions in SA, Victoria and NSW will see lower harvest totals this summer.

title.children: Drought delivers 8 per cent cut to grain production estimates

image.altText: Raina Cruise with an angry expression holding her hand up with a man standing next to her who also looks displeased.

props.synopsis: An anti-vaccine protester who assaulted a pregnant police officer and two security guards in October 2021, has been taken into custody after her suspended sentence was overturned on appeal.

title.children: Anti-vaccine protester who assaulted pregnant police officer taken into custody

image.altText: A hand holds an Aboriginal flag in front of a large banner

props.synopsis: South Australia's Aboriginal Affairs Minister says treaties with First Nations communities will not be concluded before the next state election, as Aboriginal leaders urge the state government to restart negotiations.

title.children: SA First Nations leaders await new treaty talks — but the government is 'not keen to rush'

image.altText: Dead trees stick out of a lake with a grey sky.

props.synopsis: People from across the world are travelling to far west New South Wales to witness how the floodwater is changing the landscape.

title.children: Tourists and birds flock to outback Menindee Lakes as water rises

image.altText: Port Adelaide's Ollie Wines is congratulated by fans after the Power's win over Western Bulldogs

props.synopsis: Ollie Wines is determined to get to the bottom of his heart irregularity, even if that means going under the knife for a second time at the end of the season.

title.children: Port star Wines considering second heart surgery in 'intervention plan'

image.altText: Two paramedics carry a person obscured by medical equipment on a stretcher into the back of an ambulance

props.synopsis: Two men have been arrested after three people — including one of the men charged — suffered stab wounds at an Adelaide hotel this morning.

title.children: Teenager and two men hospitalised after stabbing in Adelaide hotel

image.altText: Black and white dairy cows stand looking at the camera. The grass under them is brown

props.synopsis: "Farm exits" are predicted amid drought and floods as dairy companies announce their minimum farm gate milk prices for the next financial year.

title.children: Struggling dairy farmers disappointed with milk prices

image.altText: An overhead view of Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre.

props.synopsis: Australia’s biggest lake is believed to have reached capacity on only three occasions in the past 160 years, but the mass of floodwater now flowing into Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre is raising more than river levels.

title.children: 'Absolutely beautiful': Waters flowing into Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre a sight to behold

image.altText: A man wearing a green jacket and hat holding tomatoes.

props.synopsis: Tomato growers impacted by strict restrictions following the detection of a fruit virus last year say they hope they can now rebuild their lives as the government considers a relaxation of those rules.

title.children: Growers hope move to manage tomato virus will get them back to business

image.altText: A screenshot of a ticket website showing "Fans ahead of you in the queue: 197986"

props.synopsis: Fans complain across social media about the issues faced in buying tickets, with one saying it has been "one of the most frustrating experiences" he has been through.

title.children: Ashes tickets pre-sale sets new record but leaves some fans 'frustrated'

image.altText: William Seamons stands in front of shop window with arms folded

props.synopsis: Millions of Australian workers will get a 3.5 per cent pay rise from July 1, following the Fair Work Commission's annual review of the minimum wage and award agreements. Inflation is currently at 2.4 per cent annually.

title.children: 'A dollar for me, a dollar for my family': Minimum, award wages rise 3.5pc

image.altText: A loaded container ship sails off from a container terminal across calm blue waters.

props.synopsis: Assistant governor Sarah Hunter says Australia is unlikely to be directly impacted by Donald Trump's tariffs, but global uncertainty may cause weaker growth and labour market.

title.children: Trump tariff uncertainty brings weaker outlook for Australia, RBA official says

image.altText: White commonwealth war grave headstone which reads Q272379 Private Ngarkwokka Torres Strait Lt. Inf. Bn 20th April 1945 age 37.

props.synopsis: More than a century after his real name was written out of history, a chance encounter and a lucky find at a rubbish tip restore a soldier's true identity and return him to his family.

title.children: Pure luck identifies soldier buried with wrong name, solving 80-year-old mystery

image.altText: Israel Palestinians

props.synopsis: The Israeli military said its forces had opened fire on a group of people who had left designated routes near the US and Israeli backed food distribution site.

title.children: Third day Palestinians killed near Gaza aid site, health authorities say

image.altText: Guards stand behind police tape in front of a red brick archway.

props.synopsis: More than 200 inmates attacked guards and fled after they were allowed to leave their cells because of earthquake tremors.

title.children: Hundreds of prisoners escape after earthquake in Pakistan

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: A trial date and location have been confirmed for the man charged with the alleged murder of Ballarat mother Samantha Murphy.

title.children: Trial date set for Patrick Stephenson, accused of killing Samantha Murphy

image.altText: A man poses smiling next to some mangoes on a tree.

props.synopsis: A British tourist has had the charges against her relating to a fatal e-scooter crash upgraded, after the 51-year-old pedestrian she allegedly crashed into while intoxicated dies in a Perth hospital.

title.children: Allegedly drunk UK e-scooter rider has charges upgraded after fatal crash

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and a watch smiles at the camera in a restaurant.

props.synopsis: The 32-year-old was awaiting trial at Brisbane Women's Correctional Centre after being charged with the murder of her daughter, three-year-old Sophia Rose.

title.children: Coroner to investigate death of mother charged with murdering 3yo daughter

image.altText: Snake bite victim Tristian James Frahm wearing a Harry Potter costume

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest has been told an 11-year-old Queensland boy would likely have survived a fatal snakebite if he had received medical treatment.

title.children: Family 'haunted' by questions after boy's snakebite death

image.altText: A man's fist reaches out as a woman holds up her hand to protect herself.

props.synopsis: The longitudinal study showed social support and strong father-son relationships were key in reducing the risk of men later committing emotional or physical abuse.

title.children: One in three Australian men report using intimate partner violence, study reveals

image.altText: The rear of an ambulance driving down a wet road at dusk. The headlights of other cars can be seen shining.

props.synopsis: Distraught families say the New South Wales public mental health system abandoned their loved ones when they needed care the most — and doctors warn the crisis is only getting worse.

title.children: 'Days later she was dead': The families devastated by a collapsing mental health system

image.altText: Adolescence star Owen Cooper shared the Gotham Award for Outstanding Supporting Performance

props.synopsis: The UK limited series, which looks at the impact of the online manosphere, took home the biggest award of the night, as well as several others.

title.children: Owen Cooper wins first major award for chilling Adolescence performance

image.altText: a long slver fish washed up on a beach

props.synopsis: When Sybil Robertson took a stroll at Ocean Beach on Monday, she was unaware she was about to join the small and exclusive club of people who have found an oarfish.

title.children: Dog walker finds elusive 'doomsday' fish on remote Tasmanian beach

image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff appears to be in thought, surrounded by his colleagues.

props.synopsis: A no-confidence motion has been tabled by Labor targeting Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff over the state budget debt and his handling of the Spirit of Tasmania replacement project. Convention dictates a premier should resign if such a motion is successful.

title.children: Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff's future in the hands of the Greens

image.altText: The rear of two ambulances with green and yellow markings parked in shadow.

props.synopsis: The Australian Medical Association warns record levels of ambulance ramping could lead to increased deaths among patients waiting for emergency care, as Western Australia faces its worst flu season in at least three years.

title.children: WA records worst ambulance ramping figures for May amid spike in flu cases

image.altText: An adult cane toad sitting on the ground.

props.synopsis: Milk squeezed from the glands of cane toads could be key to controlling the invasive pests in Australia, with the toxic liquid being used to bait underwater traps.

title.children: Cane toad toxin could reshape how the invasive pests are managed

image.altText: Milos Degenek points at opponent with his left hand

props.synopsis: Miloš Degenek has played his club football in hostile environments in Serbia and believes Australia's ability to create a strong home ground advantage is hampered by Football Australia's rules and a heavy police presence at matches.

title.children: Socceroos veteran says police, flare bans restrict Australia's home advantage

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios looks down

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios's wait to return to the Wimbledon court after making the 2022 singles final extends into a third year after he confirmed a "small setback" in his injury recovery.

title.children: Injury 'setback' forces Kyrgios to miss third straight Wimbledon campaign

image.altText: police cars outside a house in croydon park where a man was stabbed and another arrested

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to the Croydon Park property just after 5pm on Monday following reports of an alleged stabbing.

title.children: Man charged with murder after body found with neck stab wounds

image.altText: A golden coloured dog in the arms of a firefighter.

props.synopsis: Ted the Labrador is rescued unharmed from an 8-metre-deep mine shaft in Central Victoria four days after escaping his backyard with labradoodle Penny.

title.children: Missing for four days, Labrador Ted turns up in a mine shaft
